alert.note: Alert for Gadsden; Leon (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 02 at 10:53AM EST until December 02 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Gadsden County in Big Bend Florida... Northeastern Leon County in Big Bend Florida... * Until 200 PM EST. * At 1053 AM EST, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain and flooded roadways across northern Leon County. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tallahassee, Midway, Forest Meadows Park, Maclay State Gardens, Lake Jackson, Market District, Orchard Pond, Macon Community Park, Bradfordville, Killearn Lakes, Killearn Estates, Lake Iamonia, Fred George Park, Gibson, Pisgah Church and Scotland. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
